verses.roman:
bālaka kahe,--gopa āmi, ei grāme vasi
āmāra grāmete keha nā rahe upavāsī

synonyms: bālaka kahe—the boy said; gopa āmi—I am a cowherd boy; ei grāme vasi—I reside in this village; āmāra grāmete—in My village; keha—anyone; nā—not; rahe—remains; upavāsī—without food.
translation: The boy replied, "Sir, I am a cowherd boy, and I reside in this village. In My village, no one fasts.
